description: Configure an additional calculation mode. This command allows the user to specify that the model is using calculation modes that either require extra resources or are restricted by the current license. The model configure command can be given at any stage of an analysis, but it must be given before the calculation mode (model solve or model cycle) can be invoked.

keywords.name: cfd
keywords.description: Enable PFC CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) analysis mode

notes: Must be given BEFORE model solve or model cycle can be invoked
Can be given at any stage of an analysis
Configures calculation modes that require extra resources or license restrictions
CFD mode enables fluid-particle coupling simulations
Once configured, the mode remains active for the model
May affect available memory and computational resources

examples.description: Enable CFD analysis mode for fluid-particle coupling

examples.command:
model new
model configure cfd
model domain extent -10 10
model cycle 1000
examples.description: Configure CFD before cycling - correct order

examples.command:
model configure cfd
ball generate number 1000 radius 0.5
; ... set up fluid domain ...
model solve
examples.description: Configure CFD, create particles and fluid domain, then solve

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('model configure cfd') - Python SDK does not provide direct configure method
